sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Microplate Reader for absorbance, fluorescence, and luminescence measurements in multi-well plate format for pharmaceutical assays.
sections.scope: Applicable to microplate-based assay activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Ensure the instrument is placed on a stable surface in a temperature-controlled environment.
Power ON the microplate reader and initialize the control software on the computer.
Allow the instrument to warm up and perform self-diagnostic tests.
Select the appropriate measurement mode (absorbance, fluorescence, or luminescence).
Set the wavelength or wavelength pair for the specific assay being performed.
Configure plate format (96-well, 384-well) and wells to be read in the software.
Prepare reagents, standards, and samples according to the assay protocol.
Add appropriate volumes to the microplate wells using calibrated pipettes or dispenser.
Ensure no air bubbles are present in the wells as they interfere with measurements.
If required, incubate the plate at specified temperature and duration before reading.
Open the plate drawer and place the microplate in the correct orientation.
Close the drawer and ensure proper positioning for measurement.
Start the reading sequence and allow the instrument to scan all designated wells.
Monitor the data acquisition and check for any error messages or anomalies.
After completion, review the raw data for outliers or inconsistent readings.
Export data to spreadsheet software for further analysis and calculations.
Remove the microplate from the reader and dispose of or store as per protocol.
Clean any spills on the plate drawer or reader surface immediately.
Document all assay parameters, plate layout, and results in the analytical record.
precautions: Always use clear bottom plates for absorbance measurements and appropriate plates for fluorescence.
Ensure plates are compatible with the reader to prevent damage.
Remove any seals or covers from plates before reading.
Avoid fingerprints or scratches on the bottom of the plate.
Do not overfill wells as spillover can contaminate adjacent wells.
Check for and remove air bubbles before reading.
Use appropriate negative and positive controls for assay validation.
Clean spills immediately to prevent damage to optical components.
Perform regular wavelength calibration and maintenance as per manufacturer guidelines.
